Russian-funded fake news network aims to disrupt election in Moldova  | BBC News
snippet:
A secret Russian-funded network is attempting to disrupt upcoming democratic elections in an eastern European state, the BBC has found.

Using an undercover reporter, we discovered the network promised to pay participants if they posted pro-Russian propaganda and fake news undermining Moldova's pro-EU ruling party ahead of the country's 28 September parliamentary ballot.

title: BBC Exposes Russian-Funded Disinformation Network Targeting Moldova's Elections
snippet: BBC investigation reveals a Russian-backed network spreading fake news to disrupt democratic elections in Moldova. Learn how the group pays participants to post pro-Russia propaganda, conduct illegal polls, and spread conspiracy theories against the EU-aligned government. Key details include ties to sanctioned oligarch Ilan Chor, the Evrazia NGO, and the use of Telegram and social media for covert operations. title: Moldova's EU membership hinges on resisting influence of pro-Russian oligarchs ‚Ä¢ FRANCE 24 English
snippet: Ever since the fall of the Soviet Union, the Republic of Moldova, a small country between Romania and Ukraine, has been grappling with the influence of oligarchs ‚Äì rich businessmen with close links to power. Often pro-Russian and backed by the Kremlin, the main oligarchs have been convicted by Moldovan courts, but have fled the country. title: Man detained after petrol bomb thrown at Russian embassy in Moldova during election
snippet:
A man has thrown a petrol bomb at the Russian embassy in Moldova as protestors take to the streets in former Soviet republics in opposition to Vladimir Putin.

Footage emerged online of a commotion in Moldova‚Äôs capital Chisinau after a man allegedly through two Molotov cocktails into the courtyard of the Russian embassy. No one was injured in the attack, Tass, a Russian state-owned news agency, reported.

title: Pro-Russian separatists ask Moscow for protection in Moldova | DW News
snippet:
The Moldovan breakaway region of Transnistria has asked Moscow for protection. The pro-Russia separatists accuse the pro-Western Moldovan government of waging economic warfare gainst them. Tensions between the two neighbours have been rising ever since Russia's invasion of Ukraine.
